flageolet noun [C]
(BEAN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also flageolet bean) a young, pale green haricot bean, eaten as a vegetable: I chose a main course of lamb with lovely green flageolets. I had the roast lamb with flageolet beans and garlic. Compare
haricot bean
More examplesFewer examplesThe flageolets in the casserole were tasty and full of flavour.Flageolets in this dish provide iron and fibre .Soak the dried flageolet beans overnight in cold water.You could add a tin of flageolet beans to bulk up the soup.

flageolet noun [C]
(MUSICAL INSTRUMENT)
a very small musical instrument similar to a recorder, played especially in the past, consisting of a tube that you blow down while covering holes with your fingers: He could play the flute, the violin and the flageolet.
More examplesFewer examplesHe lightly touched the flageolet with his lips. The music room is full of flageolets, piano accordions, xylophones and more, some more than 200 years old. He bought her an ivory flageolet and a gold heart-shaped locket.
